meanings.definition: Spin imparted to a ball by hitting it off-center.
meanings.sent1: The tennis player used sidespin to make the ball curve.
meanings.sent2: The billiards player applied sidespin to sink the ball into the corner pocket.
meanings.sent3: The soccer ball had so much sidespin that it looked like it was dancing on the field.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation had a sidespin that made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent5: The sidespin on the basketball shot was so intense, it seemed to defy gravity.

meanings.definition: A sideways rotation of an object.
meanings.sent1: The toy car's sidespin made it spin in circles.
meanings.sent2: The figure skater's graceful sidespin wowed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The sidespin of the spinning top made it look like a dizzy dancer.
meanings.sent4: The sidespin of the Earth gives us day and night.
meanings.sent5: The sidespin of the tornado twisted everything in its path.
